conclusion: Understand what the x/t vs t graph represents.
Rewrite x/t in terms of velocity: x/t = v.
Define x as position, t as time, v as velocity.
The x/t vs t graph is a straight line through the origin with a positive slope.
The straight line indicates constant velocity v over time.
To find speed at the end of 2nd second, determine v from the graph.
At t = 0, the value of x/t is 10 m/s.
The slope of the line gives velocity since x/t = v.
Velocity v is constant and equal to 10 m/s from the graph.
The speed of the car at the end of the 2nd second is 10 m/s.
